title-group.article-title: Agency Relationships in the Close Corporation

abstract.p: The theory of ownership structure based on agency costs deals with the relative amounts of equity held by inside stockholders and non-management holders. Where there are outsider stockholders, an agency relationship is created, and agency costs may be incurred. Agency costs may be especially burdensome in the close corporation, as conflicts among equal associates in a close corporation are likely to divert the firm's financial and managerial resources from productive uses, paralyze decision-making, and ultimately jeopardize the firm's solvency. This paper discusses several potential areas of conflict and provides suggested preventive measures based on a complex financial contract known as a stockholder's agreement.
